intro: Celtis ingens, commonly known as the large-leafed hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to the Americas. It belongs to the Elm family (Ulmaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, green fruits that turn dark when mature. Celtis ingens is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, thriving in a variety of soil types. Its ecological importance includes providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
